title: Cat Aging Formula
description: The first year of a cat's life equals about 15 human years, the second year adds 9 more years, and each year after that equals about 4 human years.

title: Indoor vs Outdoor Cats
description: Indoor cats typically live 12-18 years, while outdoor cats average 2-5 years due to various environmental risks.

title: Senior Cat Age
description: Cats are considered senior when they reach 7-10 years old, which is equivalent to 44-56 human years.

title: Kitten Development
description: A 6-month-old kitten is roughly equivalent to a 10-year-old human child in terms of development and energy levels.

title: Cat Sleep Patterns
description: Cats sleep 12-16 hours per day, which is similar to newborn humans but continues throughout their adult life.
